item.title: Rydox Cybercrime Marketplace Disrupted, Administrators Arrested
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US announced the takedown of Rydox, a marketplace for stolen personal information, and the arrest of three administrators.

The post Rydox Cybercrime Marketplace Disrupted, Administrators Arrested appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 9, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 9, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Microsoft Patches Vulnerabilities in Windows Defender, Update Catalog
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Microsoft has patched potentially critical vulnerabilities in Update Catalog and Windows Defender on the server side. 

The post Microsoft Patches Vulnerabilities in Windows Defender, Update Catalog  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Germany Sinkholes Botnet of 30,000 BadBox-Infected Devices
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Germany’s cybersecurity agency BSI has sinkholed a botnet of 30,000 devices shipped with BadBox malware pre-installed.

The post Germany Sinkholes Botnet of 30,000 BadBox-Infected Devices appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Iranian Hackers Use IOCONTROL Malware to Target OT, IoT Devices in US, Israel
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The Iranian threat group CyberAv3ngers has used custom-built malware named IOCONTROL to target IoT and OT devices in the US and Israel.

The post Iranian Hackers Use IOCONTROL Malware to Target OT, IoT Devices in US, Israel appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fake IT Workers Funneled Millions to North Korea, DOJ Says
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The Justice Department announced indictments against 14 North Koreans for involvement in a scheme to pose as remote IT workers to violate sanctions and commit wire fraud, money laundering, and identity theft.

The post Fake IT Workers Funneled Millions to North Korea, DOJ Says appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Phishing: The Silent Precursor to Data Breaches
item.dc:creator: Torsten George
item.description:
Phishing is more than a mere nuisance—it is a formidable precursor to destructive data breaches.

The post Phishing: The Silent Precursor to Data Breaches appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Silent Push Raises $10 Million for Preemptive Threat Intelligence Platform
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat intel startup Silent Push has raised $10 million in a funding round co-led by Ten Eleven Ventures and Stepstone Group LP.

The post Silent Push Raises $10 Million for Preemptive Threat Intelligence Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Sublime Snags $60M Series B for Email Security Tech
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Sublime said the new capital was provided by IVP, Citi Ventures, Index Ventures, Decibel Partners, and Slow Ventures and brings the total raised to $93.8 million.

The post Sublime Snags $60M Series B for Email Security Tech appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fortinet Acquires Perception Point Reportedly for $100 Million
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Fortinet has acquired Israeli collaboration and email security company Perception Point to expand its offering.

The post Fortinet Acquires Perception Point Reportedly for $100 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Ghost of Christmas Past – AI’s Past, Present and Future
item.dc:creator: Marc Solomon
item.description:
The potential for how AI may change the way we work is endless, but we are still a way off from this and careful planning and consideration is what is needed. 

The post The Ghost of Christmas Past – AI’s Past, Present and Future appeared first on SecurityWeek.
